comment: Dr.Gabriel really knows his stuff and is very good at explaining the concepts. It's chemistry though so theres really only so much he can do. I wish he were staying at KSU!

Great professor, hard class. He tends to weed out the slackers by the first test, but he becomes far less intimidating afterwards. Very nit-picky, and cramming before an exam will result in a horrible grade. Study ahead, get a study group, and ask for help. The class is not as bad as it is made out to be at all.

I read every chapter and came to every class, and I barely made a B. Dr. Gabriel is an excellent professor; there is just a lot of information. There are always little details on the multiple choice and short answer questions that will kill your grade. If you are a procrastinator, prepare for a lot of sleepless nights.

He knows what he's doing, don't be discouraged to ask questions in class and don't bother raising your hand. He is willing to help even if he comes across as unapproachable.I recommend recording lectures, testing is based completely off lectures and ch. handouts, The course is difficult you have to earn your grade, made an A! He makes material fun

Great professor!  Very helpful and makes the class enjoyable.  Go to the review sessions, they are extremely helpful.  Tests are straightforward (make sure you know your reactions) and from the handouts and notes.  Made an A.
VERY DEMANDING CLASS! Study groups make a HUGE difference each Test is 26% of your grade! nice guy and willing to help. 4 tests one is dropped.
Good Professor interesting subject.  Overall grade distribution was higher than I thought it would be.  Not overly difficult but you have to study.

Dr. Gabriel is such a great teacher. Organic chemistry is a difficult subject matter but he explains it a way that makes it easier to understand. The tests are straight forward and not too difficult if you study. The class requires a lot of out of class time for studying. Take him!

New teacher. Very helpful. Only used textbook for hw problems. If you know the handouts front and back then you will get an A on every test. Also his study groups before the test were EXTREMELY helpful! I would def take this teacher.

ok.. you definietly need to work you butt off in this class. make a study group and go to his office hours. never miss a class cause you will be screwed. he really cares about his students and he makes himself available for you. you get the grade that you deserve in this class, but there is not a better professor at kennesaw!

Ok lecturer and will curve your grade if your a D or C student. But if your a B student you will get no curve so that his grade distribution will not be affected. He cares more about the grade distribution than anything else. If people do well he makes it harder and if people do poor he makes it easier. He can be unfair.

I took this professor because his ratings were high and previous students recommended him. I am confused, he is not a good teacher, he is too fast, and he assumes I already know the material. This is my second day of class and I am already failing.I have to read the book and then read his notes. That is my plan for future tests.

Dr. Gabriel is one of the best teachers at KSU. He puts a lot of effort into preparing classes and really tries to keep it interesting.He is great during office hours for extra help. Do the reading, homework problems and sit near the front of the class. He also has extra credit available on occasion!

Do not like chemistry too much but enjoyed the class. Gabriel is brilliant. final was either 20% of grade or if higher than lowest test replaced it and was 40% of grade. lots of practice problems. chances for extra points in class. Similar to Tapu's class.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!! You printout notes from Vista prior to lecture; he teaches through it and gives examples.EXTREMELY helpful.  You only need to use the book for practice problems.He gives practice tests.emails back, posts grades, posts discussions very quickly!I NEVER read the book, only did problems from it.  Got an A!!

I was intimidated by the thought of organic chem but Dr. Gabriel is great! He is ALWAYS available via email or office hours for help. The course is hard but he gives you a lot of practice problems. There are also extra credit opportunities. His lectures are really thorough and he makes a hard subject feasible. I would definitely recommend him!

Dr. Gabriel was great! The only reason for not doing well in this class would be if you don't study. Final is worth a large portion of your grade so save yourself the stress and push to do well on the tests!!

I am AWFUL in Chemistry, but Professor Gabriel explains things so well. I was actually able to understand the concepts and do well on the test. Although he seems a bit confused at times, he still knows his stuff.  I would recommend him!

If you think Gabriel is hard, it is only because you haven't had Tapu. The only real complaint about his class is  that the Final is worth 34% of you grade. other than that he's pretty easy as long as you keep up with the problem sets. He's easy to talk to if you need help. He's picky but he's fair.

Awesome teacher! The class started off a little rough because we were his first class (he was a new teacher), but he proved to be a great teacher in the end. He  loves his subject, and he genuinely cares about his students. As with any Chemistry class, as long as you keep up with the problem sets and do the practice tests you should make an A.
The final is worth 34% of the grade and is way harder than the other tests; however, if you do the problem sets you should get an A or B.

Final is 10x harder than the other tests and is worth 34%.  Yes, 34%.  Still, I thought the class was an easy A.  I probably spent 6 hours a week studying, and got close to a 100 in the class.  Do the problems sets, read the chapters before class, and email him any questions that arise.  Easy A.

This teacher is horrible. He is a new teacher and it definitely shows! He expects his students to be perfect when he himself makes mistakes all of the time. Have either a test or a quiz every week. He doesn't bump up borderline grades. So if you get a 79.9 it won't be a B! He does drop 2 quizzes and 1 test but his tests are extremely hard!Stay away
